title: Curvy
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020035807im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fest1_4778.png)

I'd love some opinions on this one. It's for a music and arts festival.
author: Frode Bo Helland

comments.content:
A rough on rough paper Frode... but you might want to consider looping the t serif under to enclose the 09.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020035807im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fest_6590.png)

Michael

I like that last one, with the larger '09. You could extend the top stroke of the F a bit further, although maybe not as far as in the previous one. I also think Michael's F avoids the possibility of yours being mistaken for a J.

it's called fest? really? really really? nothing else?

----------  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Designer](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020035807/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)  
 [Short Film Festival](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020035807/http:/www.showusyourshorts.com.au/)

It's like those Snickers ads: "FEST!!!!"

I think your latest version is the tidiest. The 09 fits nicely under the arm of the 't'.

I read it as Fest right off and I think it is lovely. Only part my eye gets caught up on is the overlap on the t at the end. I'd like it better if it were just a smooth line. The other examples are nice as well.
Salisae: Do you mean the first version?
yes – I was going to specify but assumed that was the one in question

I'm leaning towards the last one.  
Here's the host name in style, for posters and such.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020035807im_/http:/typophile.com/files/filaung_6346.png)
